intro: Craibia brevicaudata subsp. brevicaudata, commonly known as the broadleaf craibia, is a perennial shrub native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain several seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil.
